Description: Body sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery amphora(?); interior reserved; exterior, cream slip; glaed on right, three bands below; in panel to left rear of seated feline, probably sphinx, and sprouting from the corner a lotus flower with worn added red.
Curator's comments: The curvature of the sherds is substantial for an amphora, but a krater or dinos with such panel decoration would be unusual.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.012)
